definition: to harness/to draw (a cart etc)/to drive/to pilot/to sail/to ride/your good self/prefixed word denoting respect (polite 敬辞)
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
to urge on (of horse)/to drive/to steer/to handle/to manage/to master/to dominate
driving school/abbr. for 駕駛學校|驾驶学校
(in former times) to escort the emperor (or other important personage)/(nowadays) to escort sb (usually jocular)
to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
lit. an easy drive on a familiar path (idiom); fig. experience makes progress easy/a task that is so familiar one can do it with one's hand tied behind one's back

sentences.english: More folks are killed by dwi than guns.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，比起枪击更多的人可是死于醉驾的。

sentences.english: On his arrival, the pontiff circled the park packed stadium in his popemobile.
sentences.chinese: 教皇到达后，乘坐其座驾环绕满是人群的体育场。

sentences.english: And they ascended up to heaven in a cloud;
He flew over the Great Wall in a paraglider .
sentences.chinese: 他驾着滑翔伞飞越了长城。

sentences.english: He took the book down from the shelf.
sentences.chinese: 他从书驾上取下那本书。

sentences.english: But where is the silver chariot headed?
sentences.chinese: 但那驾银制马车将前往何方？

sentences.english: Wall mounting type install in W. H.
He made him ride on the high places of the earth, that he might eat the increase of the fields;
sentences.chinese: 耶和华使他乘驾地的高处，得吃田间的土产。

sentences.english: Driving without a driver's license is against the traffic law.
sentences.chinese: 没有驾就照开车是违反交通法的。

sentences.english: The newlyweds ride a carriage across Westminster Bridge after their wedding ceremony on July 29, 1981.
sentences.chinese: 典礼之后新婚夫妇驾马车驶过威斯敏斯特大桥。

sentences.english: For six months I drove around town with that busted car.
sentences.chinese: 六个月后我驾着那辆破车在镇里四处逛。

sentences.english: He used to be pottering about in a canoe on summer afternoons.
sentences.chinese: 他过去常常在夏日午后驾轻舟荡漾。

sentences.english: We drove in a buggy past the Dorset house.
sentences.chinese: 我们驾了一辆单骑独座的小马车经过道塞特家的住宅。

sentences.english: One afternoon Matthew drove the horse and cart to the station.
sentences.chinese: 一天下午，马修驾着马车来到火车站。

sentences.english: And when you did the outside loop last week.
sentences.chinese: 你上周驾飞机在空中翻筋斗。

definition: driving under the influence of alcohol (DUI)
to drive a vehicle for its owner (often as a paid service for sb who has consumed alcohol) (abbr. for 代理駕駛|代理驾驶[dai4 li3 jia4 shi3])/substitute driver (abbr. for 代駕司機|代驾司机[dai4 jia4 si1 ji1])
drunk driving (very high blood alcohol concentration)
traffic police/abbr. for 交通警察
drink and drive (moderately high blood alcohol concentration)
to gallop/speedily/to proceed to/to pilot (ship, plane etc)/to sail
to sit astride/to ride (a horse, bike etc)/classifier for saddle horses
